job_description: Junior Data Scientist - job post Studio X 12 reviews Austin, TX â€¢ Remote Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time General Overview Studio X is a global innovation studio accelerating the pace of energy innovation, by harnessing the spirit of innovation, collaboration, community, and a passion for pursuing what's possible. With Studio X, people are able to come together from around the world to transform the way energy innovation works. Together we can equip top talent with cutting-edge tools, data, and resources from one of the world's largest companies in order to disrupt a multi-trillion dollar industry. Currently, Studio X is comprised of three distinct offerings: XCover offers new ways of utilizing technology and talent to solve complex energy problems. We create pathways to accelerate results for energy projects, and enable innovation to go further, faster. Xeek unleashes our data science community to solve difficult energy challenges. Working with Xeek gives you exposure to thousands of different experiences and perspectives from around the world that are simply not available in any one company. SixLa b is a startup accelerator focused on energy innovation. Participants can leverage the skills and experience of the Studio X community, the tools and platform of Xeek, and the AI/ML innovation from our core data and geoscience teams. What You'll Do The Xeek Data Scientist will support the development and launching of data science challenges on the Xeek platform. In this role, you will work with stakeholders to understand their requirements for a challenge and how to communicate it to a community of data scientists. Your insights and skills will be needed in maturing challenges toward launch, ensuring that the end products of a challenge meet the stakeholders desired outcomes and that the challenges are engaging for the Xeek Community. This role needs the ability to pick up new technical disciplines and data types, good attention to detail, and communication skills to be successful. This role will report to the Director of Xeek. Your responsibilities will include: Help define and uncover the scope of a challenge through discussions with stakeholders Work with Xeek Engineers and Data Scientists to ensure that the elements for a challenge are robust and ready for timely launches. Develop of multiple challenges at different levels of maturity Help communicate with the Xeek Community through forum discussions and support tickets. Find new and creative ways to introduce data and concepts to stakeholders and Community members. What You'll Bring A minimum of 5 years of experience working in a role where your primary responsibility was building machine learning models Ability to quickly pick up new technologies and scientific disciplines Self-starter - can make progress independently A strong background in data science as well as fluency in Python Excellent collaboration for engaging both internal and external stakeholders Communicate effectively to deliver requirements for product and engineering teams Additional Attributes Experience solving complex problems for stakeholders AWS experience, especially SageMaker Ability to prototype ideas from different scientific disciplines quickly Work experience with Python. Other languages are a plus Clear documentation background Education MS/PhD degree or equivalent practical experience. Presents technical results through the drafting of technical reports and presentation materials. Presents experimental results and recommended actions at internal project meetings. interface Ability to work independently and to interact effectively with individuals on multi-disciplinary teams Team player with a positive attitude Preferred Experience in analytical chemistry or Experience in developing proteomics or metabolomics data analysis pipelines Experience with NextFlow, SnakeMake, or similar workflow/pipeline management systems Experience in developing natural language processing (NLP) and/or machine vision models Previous research and development experience related to chemical, biological, radiological, nuclear, and/or explosive (CBRNE) threats Working knowledge of good software development practices such as version control systems (e.g., Git) and Agile development (e.g., workflows, sprints) Ability to develop and query relational databases (MySQL Responsibilities: Essential Duties (at least 5 that are non-negotiable duties and are absolutely pertinent to successfully completing the job without accommodations): Build statistical (including predictive) models for various projects that range from program evaluation to population management. Perform quantitative and qualitative data analyses and prepare results to share with internal and external customers. Aid in design and development of data warehouse/data mart applications. Communicate highly technical information to numerous audiences including internal and external stakeholders and the community. Undertake complex data integration activities. Identify and troubleshoot data anomalies and irregularities. Prepare written and oral reports that communicate necessary information to internal and external customers. Produce and streamline as needed ongoing monthly, quarterly and annual reports in support of Central Health. Become a data subject matter expert (SME) and understand various sources and applications of Central Health data. Performs other duties as assigned. Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, optimization, clustering, decision trees, random forests, etc.). Experience using statistical computer languages to build efficient models. Exceptional critical thinking and problem solving skills. Keen understanding of data structure/ data architecture. Ability to manipulate data using SQL in SSMS environment. Familiarity with healthcare data from multiple sources including claims and EHR data. Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects with varying deadlines. Compliance with data confidentiality and security procedures. Experience with Microsoft Office applications specifically MS Word, MS Excel and MS Outlook. Ability to write and speak clearly, easily communicating complex ideas as indicated by audience. Knowledge of healthcare, including medical claims coding, relationships between health plans, providers, and payers, a plus. Qualifications: MINIMUM EDUCATION: Masterâ€™s in Biostatistics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field PREFERRED EDUCATION: PhD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field MINIMUM EXPERIENCE: 2 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, including predictive models 1 year of experience with healthcare data 2 years of experience with R scripting 2 years of experience with SQL coding PREFERRED EXPERIENCE: Experience with programming or scripting languages such as Python, Julia, MATLAB, Python, C++ Experience with Tableau data visualization tool Experience with REDCap data repository Experience with Java Experience with MS Excel

Strong communication skills. The position will include a full-time benefits package. Security sensitive; criminal background checks conducted on selected candidate. Hiring decision is contingent upon applicant clearing background requirement. Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis and evaluated via an accelerated video interview and decision process. Purpose The Meyers Lab and UT Center for Pandemic Decision Science at The University of Texas at Austin are immediately seeking an outstanding postdoctoral scholar to help with the development of innovative pandemic simulation games to: (1) elucidate individual and group decision making dynamics during pathogen threat events and (2) support pandemic preparedness efforts, including the development of pandemic response plans and the training of governmental decision makers. The simulation games will integrate computational models of disease and behavioral dynamics and draw on scientific theories from the field of cognitive science and engineering regarding situational awareness and decision making. The scholar will work under the supervision and mentorship of Professors Lauren Ancel Meyers and Francesca de Rosa and engage directly with governmental stakeholders. We seek candidates with strong quantitative training in one or more of the following areas: (1) computational epidemiology and/or computational behavioral science (2) reasoning under uncertainty and information fusion, (3) human factors and cognitive engineering with a focus on situational awareness and decision making, (4) statistics, machine learning and artificial intelligence. Preference will be given to candidates with knowledge of infectious disease epidemiology, simulation gaming for crisis preparedness and response, strong coding skills, and interdisciplinary research experience. To apply, email a cover letter indicating earliest available start date and two reference letters to: utpandemics@austin.utexas.edu. Responsibilities Identify and pursue novel research problems in the area of simulation gaming to advance public health threat preparedness and decision making Lead the development, refinement, validation, and implementation of pandemic-related simulation games Disseminate results to scientists, public health agencies, and general public via publications, reports, and presentations Mentor of undergraduate and graduate students Act as a liaison and professionally represent the Meyers Lab and UT Center for Pandemic Decision Science with various stakeholders, including local, state, and national government agencies. Required Qualifications PhD in quantitative science, social science, statistics, computer science, mathematics, engineering, or a related discipline must have been received within the past 3 years. The position will also require the ability to work quickly and collaborate with an interdisciplinary and multinational team. Salary $65,000 to $70,000 Required Materials Resume/ CV Cover Letter PhD Verification (Examples of official documentation of the degree include: Copy of diploma (preferred) or official English translation of diploma, Copy of a letter of completion on letterhead from the office of the registrar or graduate office confirming completion of degree requirements, Copy of official transcript in English with "degree awarded" information.) 2 work references with contact information; at least one should be from a supervisor. To apply, email a cover letter indicating earliest available start date and two reference letters to: utpandemics@austin.utexas.edu.
